intro: Thibaudia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and produces showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long blooming period.
